intro: Angelica longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed angelica, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its tall, slender stems and compound leaves. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and grows in alpine environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. Its roots are thick and fleshy, often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Angelica longipes is valued for its aromatic qualities and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
